content:
Formatting
* Please study the formatting syntax on this page: https://www.codingame.com/playgrounds/40701/help-center/statement , and format your statement properly as described in the points below.

Input
* Please format "Line 1" and "Line 2" in <<bold>>.

* Please format "N" as a [[variable]].

Output
* Please format "N" as a [[variable]].

Constraints
* Please format "N" as a [[variable]].

Stub generator
* Please add a write statement, e.g. write answer.

Cases
* Test 3: Please remove the trailing newlines from the input.

* Please add more pairs of cases as per the last point in @User123's comment below, and ensure that the range of N is utilised as much as possible (e.g. 10 ≤ N < 40 in Test/Validator 5, 40 ≤ N < 70 in Test/Validator 6, 71 ≤ N ≤ 100 in Test/Validator 7), and random numbers are used in the lists.

Thanks.

- Please format N as a [[variable]] in the Input, Output, and Constraints sections.

- If possible, please include a write statement in the stub generator.

- Please add more test cases where N is much larger. Currently, the largest N given for all test cases is N = 12. Please also try to have more variation (e.g. more negative numbers, more 3-digit numbers, etc.) between array elements.

Thank you!
Thank you for the suggestion! I will try and implement these as soon as possible :).
Thank you! This is my first contribution... (I haven't really studied mechanics) but I will try to implement these and message you when complete.
